current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require that Federal regulations use plain writing
		  that is clear, concise, and well-organized, and follows other best practices
		  appropriate to the subject or field and intended audience.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

short-title.#text:
Plain Writing Act for Regulations
			 of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

The purpose of this Act is to require that
			 Federal regulations use plain writing, to enhance public understanding of
			 regulations, and to increase the level of public participation in the
			 rulemaking process.
In this Act:

term.#tail: means an Executive agency, as that term is defined in

				Budget

means writing that is
			 clear, concise, and well-organized, and follows other best practices
			 appropriate to the subject or field and intended audience.

header.#text:
Preparation for

text.#text:
Not later than 9 months after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, the head of each agency shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 any other provision of law;

text.#text:
ensure that the
			 obligation of the agency to use plain writing in no way diminishes the ability
			 of the agency to perform scientific analyses or technical analyses, or disclose
			 scientific data or technical data or any other findings, that are required to
			 be performed or disclosed under

communicate the
			 requirements of this Act to the employees of the agency;

train employees
			 of the agency to write regulations using plain writing;

establish a
			 process for overseeing the ongoing compliance of the agency with the
			 requirements of this Act; and

designate an
			 employee of the agency to serve as a point of contact to receive and respond to
			 public input on—

the
			 implementation of this Act by the agency; and

the agency
			 reports required under

text.#text: The individual designated under

Not later than
			 12 months after the date of enactment of this Act, each agency shall use plain
			 writing in accordance with the guidance issued by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in each proposed or final regulation
			 issued or substantially revised by the agency.

header.#text:
Requirement To
			 use plain writing in new and revised regulations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that the agency
			 head has read the proposed or final rule and that the rulemaking documents use
			 plain writing.

text.#text:
For each proposed or final regulation issued by an
			 agency, the head of the agency shall certify to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, if the agency head certifies that the sole reason for the
			 information collection is to improve the clarity of the regulation in
			 accordance with this Act.

text.#text:
An agency action to
			 collect information from the public about a regulation is exempt from the
			 information collection provisions of

header.#text:
Exemption from
			 certain information collection provisions

Responsibilities
			 of the Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 develop and issue guidance on implementing the requirements of this Act that
			 ensures that the head of each agency understands that the obligation of the
			 agency to use plain writing does not in any way diminish the ability of the
			 agency to perform scientific analyses or technical analyses, or disclose
			 scientific data or technical data or any other findings, that are required to
			 be performed or disclosed by

, or any
			 other provision of law. The

may designate a lead agency, and may use
			 interagency working groups to assist in developing and issuing the
			 guidance.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish each certification
			 required under

on the official website of the Office of Management
			 and Budget.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Plain Writing Act for Regulations of 2013/s:4/ss:c

text.#text: The

Not later than 9 months after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, the head of each agency shall publish on the plain writing section of
			 the website of the agency created under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report that describes the agency plan for compliance with the
			 requirements of this Act.

text.#text:
Not later than 18 months after the date of
			 enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the head of each agency shall
			 publish on the plain writing section of the website of the agency a report on
			 the compliance of the agency with the requirements of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit a report to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental
			 Affairs of the Senate

Committee on Oversight and Government Reform of
			 the House of Representatives

text.#text:
Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, and annually thereafter, the

evaluates the
			 extent to which regulations use plain writing, by conducting a survey of
			 different intended audiences for a representative sample of major regulations
			 that measures—

the level of
			 comprehension of each respondent for each regulation; and

the satisfaction
			 of each respondent with the plain writing used in each regulation, focusing on
			 whether the regulation uses writing that is clear, concise, and well-organized,
			 and follows other best practices appropriate to the subject or field and
			 intended audience of the regulation;

assesses the
			 extent to which plain writing helped increase the level of public participation
			 in the rulemaking process; and

provides
			 recommendations to—

improve
			 compliance with the requirements of this Act; and

better use plain
			 writing to enhance public understanding of regulations and increase public
			 participation in the rulemaking process.

There shall be no judicial review of compliance or
			 noncompliance with any provision of this Act.

No
			 provision of this Act may be construed to create any right or benefit,
			 substantive or procedural, enforceable by any administrative or judicial
			 action.
